info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 6:52PM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL FAYETTE...EAST CENTRAL MONONGALIA AND NORTHERN PRESTON COUNTIES... At 651 PM EDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms was centered 7 miles west of Friendsville, or 13 miles north of Terra Alta, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Kingwood, Terra Alta, Albright, Markleysburg, Brandonville, Bruceton Mills, Valley Point, Elgon, Laurel Run, Hazelton, Cranesville, and Clifton Mills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
